bug.short_desc: nfs-utils includes a unit file for rpc.svcgssd, but not the daemon
bug.cf_release_notes: rpc.svcgssd no longer built by default. Should remove .service file from package.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The nfs-utils package includes a unit file for starting rpc.svcgssd, but doesn't include the daemon or its man page.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): nfs-utils-1.3.3-8.rc5.fc24.x86_64

Thank you for taking the time to report this bug
Steve Dickson disabled support for the building of ggsd by default in this commit
https://github.com/stefanha/nfs-utils/commit/24b5d60d7f0a514310df810e3eb27b72f665febf
The recommendation is to use gssproxy instead.
I'll close this out for now. If you feel this doesn't address your issue please feel free to re-open. If you do if you can have a read over https://bugzilla.redhat.com/page.cgi?id=bug-writing.html and request one specific issue you would like to be addressed and exactly what your expectation from the bug is.
e.g. If the request is to have the default reverted e.g. a package feature request
That would be more suitable on the package maintainers wish list which you can find
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Package_maintainers_wishlist

(In reply to Brian O'Regan from comment #1) > I'll close this out for now. If you feel this doesn't address your issue > please feel free to re-open. If you do if you can have a read over > https://bugzilla.redhat.com/page.cgi?id=bug-writing.html and request one > specific issue you would like to be addressed and exactly what your > expectation from the bug is.
The Fedora package includes a .service file which provides systemd with information about starting a binary which is no longer in the package. My expectation was that either the .service file would be removed from the Fedora package, or the daemon would be re-added.

Nalin,
Thank you for the clarification.
As upstream is defaulting to not build svcgssd by default and promote the use of gssproxy it's best to request the removal of the service file or get more clarification from Steve why it's been left there.
UPDATE: Request for svcgssd service file to be removed from nfs-utils package.
